Q1: Missing planned work due to smartphone use.
Q2: Having a hard time concentrating in class, while doing assignments, or while working due to smartphone use.
Q3: Experiencing lightheadedness or blurred vision due to excessive smartphone use.
Q4: Feeling pain in the wrists or at the back of the neck while using a smartphone.
Q5: Feeling tired and lacking adequate sleep due to excessive smartphone use.
Q6: Feeling calm or cozy while using a smartphone.
Q7: Feeling pleasant or excited while using a smartphone.
Q8: Feeling confident while using a smartphone.
Q9: Being able to get rid of stress with a smartphone.
Q10: There is nothing more fun to do than using my smartphone.
Q11: My life would be empty without my smartphone.
Q12: Feeling most liberal while using a smartphone.
Q13: Using a smartphone is the most fun thing to do.
Q14: wouldn't be able to stand not having a smartphone.
Q15: Feeling impatient and fretful when I am not holding my smartphone.
Q16: Having my smartphone in my mind even when I am not using it.
Q17:
I will never give up using my smartphone even when my daily life is already greatly affected
by it.
Q18: Getting irritated when bothered while using my smartphone.
Q19: Bringing my smartphone to the toilet even when I am in a hurry to get there.
Q20: Feeling great meeting more people via smartphone use.
Q21:
Feeling that my relationships with my smartphone buddies are more intimate than my

Q22: Not being able to use my smartphone would be as painful as losing a friend.
Q23: Feeling that my smartphone buddies understand me better than my real-life friends.
Q24:
Constantly checking my smartphone so as not to miss conversations between other people

Q25: Checking SNS (Social Networking Service) sites like Twitter or Facebook right after waking up.

Preferring talking with my smartphone buddies to hanging out with my real-life friends or

Q27: Preferring searching from my smartphone to asking other people.
Q28: My fully charged battery does not last for one whole day.
Q29: Using my smartphone longer than I had intended.
Q30: Feeling the urge to use my smartphone again right after I stopped using it.
Q31: Having tried time and again to shorten my smartphone use time, but failing all the time.
Q32: Always thinking that I should shorten my smartphone use time.
Q33: The people around me tell me that I use my smartphone too much.
